column2: The Etruscan 'goddess' was a seeker of sensations and innovations at any cost. Mistress of the Italian peninsula, she left it one night without a trace.
The German Ventrue have supplanted their Roman cousins as masters of the clan. Regal and loyalists to a fault, they are the model of any true Ventrue.
The Once and Forever King of England is perhaps one of the most influential Ventrue of History. His lineage carry great strenght and expectations.
Often mistaken for a Toreador, the Prince of Paris is a lover of arts and beauty... but also prone to jealousy and indolence.
The Architect of Constantinople, member of the Dream, was a vampire of overwhelming passion.
The Boy-King of Cairo has dreams of Godhood and little patience for competing challengers to his claim.
The Eternal Consul was once master of Rome, uniter of vampire kind and destroyer of Troile and unholy Carthage. His lineage sweels with rightful pride.
One of the few Ventrue to always refuse Roman's rule, his lineage are the true ancestors of Germany's vampire.
The beloved of Ventrue was a fierce battle maiden and lover of philosophy. She was the first to charge hated Carthage, and the first to fall.
An oddity among the Ventrue, Bindusara is a scholar with very poor understandings of politics, making his lineage challenged to hold their own as kings of the night.
His very existence is a mystery and everything regarding this vampire and his potential lineage is a secret well kept.
Cruel and bestial, the Arakur lineage seems also prone to bad decisions at a whim, reflecting their foolish ancestor.
The God King of the Aegean was blinded by his hubris and was the first of his age to be killed by mere kine.
Defiant and rebel, this lineage is prideful on its connection to the legendary woman who fought Set himself to a standstill.
The Children of Carthage pushed back the Ventrue after their great atrocity. They still protect the Middle East and beyond from their ancient foe.
The lineage of the great foe of Rome is made of great strategists but often oblivious to political intrigues.
An oddity of their clan, this Italian lineage is made of astute, wise and political Brujah, often seen as princes or kingmakers.
The centerpiece of any Anarch movement, the Leeland lineage will never relent until all Tyrants have been dealt with permanently.
The philosopher King was a paragon of Carthage. His dynasty respects wisdom and cunning, but takes a very hard stance on any hints of betrayal.
The Mercenary Lord of Carthage burns with hatred for all the cowardly Ventrue who destroyed his beloved utopia.
A mysterious part of Troile's legacy, the children of Gersakkun are respected for their ancient link to the phoenician cradle of the clan.
The true Childrens of Brujah are recluse scholars, watching the pitiful 'main clan' angering himself into oblivion.
The master of Burgundy is a shrewd and efficient administrator, and a seeker of Golconda.
The conniving Jerusalemite known as Azif is a known diablerist and his lineage carry this shame in their veins.
The heirs of Michael are the legacy of the greatest utopia the cainite world has ever seen : Constantinople.
The Queen of the Courts of Love is the powerful matriarch of a grand lineage of political minded Toreador.
Artists, thieves, envious, the lineage of the mysterious Spanish Methuselah is many things and more.
Lost in history, Nicholas has failed to make any impressions on the cainite world. His lineage has a mountain to climb.
The 'archangel' of Normandy is a charismatic individual rumored to have dealings with the Cainite Heresy.
Beautiful doesn't even start to describe the lineage of the Troyan. Even a glance from them seems like a blessing from the heavens.
The northern Toreador are still passionate individuals, seeking beauty in the far reaches of Europe.
A fairly minor lineage of the Toreador clan, the Lubbock always seek to prove their artistic worth to their peers.
Cruel and spiteful, the French Baron was also blind to the intrigues of those he saw as his lessers.
Even by Toreador standards, Apollo cainites are quick to love and quicker to depress over lost love.
Scribes and scholars of the eastern world, this lineage faces a schism between elders and younglings.
The clever Prince, first childe of Malkav, is a mysterious being determined to bring down the mirage that is sanity.
Scholars and oracles of the Middle-East, these malkavians enjoy a more respected reputation than their western cousins.
Not much is known about Lamdiel, except his fascination about appearing as visions into the dreams and nightmars of his lineage.
Rumored to feed on 'True Names', the Eater is a dark legend among malkavians, and his lineage is mostly silent about their progenitor.
The lineage of Indian priests is surprinsigly sane, and was the catalyst for many majors events in the clan history.
Relentless scholar, De Laurent has made namy friends, and many more foes during his travels around the world.
The prince of Hamburg is a puppet of stronger cainites, his lineage is often found in situations way over their heads.
Plagued by a split personality, the Banes lineage is a complex amalgam of Tyrants and Caretakers, often at the same time.
Handmaiden and lover of Malkav, the Plague Bride was broken by her Sire's death and is still tryting to make sense of it to this night.
The Biblical Elimelech of Judea is a fearsome monster, having long ago shreded any remnants of sanity in his mind.
This Finiish lineage is one of witches and abhorrents spells, only dedicated to doom and darkness.
Created by the Lasombra Marconius, this bloodline presents fae like traits and a brooding contenance.
The eldest childe of Lasombra is a staunch loyalist, his sire's keeper and a master of obtenebration without compare.
The master of Christian Iberia is a fierce foe of the andalusian Ashirra, and intends his future victory as his first powerplay in the grand scheme of things.
The lineage of the great Heretic has an heavy burden to bear, the stain and the legacy of the Cainite Heresy is theirs by right.
Second Childe of Lasombra, Boukephos was a Philosopher King of Greece, and retains his teaching habits in the night life.
This mysterious figure, believed to be from another continent altogether, is rumored to be the only female Lasombra ever truly embraced.
The Veronese is the youngest Childe of Lasombra. Proud and ambitious to a fault, his destiny won't be an easy one.
One of the elusive 4th generation guardians of Lasombra's tomb, known for her devious tactics.
An almost unknown Childe of Lasombra, only recorded as Sylvester de Ruiz and Ambrosio Moncada ancestor.
The Muslim Lasombra are fighting for their survival against the Christians who have exiled them from the clan.
Of dubious loyalty to any sect, this lineage is plagued by internal conflicts akin to the clan as a whole.
Master of Domination, this Childe of Lasombra is an old foe of the powerful Mithras of London, continuing the millenia old feud between their respective clans.
One of the protectors of Lasombra's tomb, rumored to be the owner of powerfuls artefacts.
A mostly forgotten and unknown Childe of Lasombra. Said to be a native of a strange continent.
Oriental Gangrels friendly, but wary, towards Islam, these vampires are nomadic and decentralized by nature.
The druidic bloodline is fighting a losing battle against Christianity and all its followers, living or not.
The Einherjar, children of Caharl, are slowly losing ground to the followers of the Cross. But they won't go down without a brutal, epic final battle.
Solitary and brooding, the Basque vampire is only interested on being left alone.
The Hun nearly destroyed Rome once and is still whsipered among the Ventrue as one of the greatest foe the clan has ever defeated.
This theologist is responsable for the creation of the Path of Lilith, an aberration to many cainites prizing their biblical origin story.
This mongol lineage is one of impressive dueling and leadership skills, perhaps the last hurrah of the dying pagan world.
The God-King of Nubia was soundly beaten by the Setite clan long before Christ. His lineage is still one of pride and empire buidling.
A wild woman of the Icelandic wastes, Vola 'the Red' is a consummate raider and an uncaring mistress.
First Childe of Tzimisce, this bloodthirsty warrior rampages across India from his lair in Sri Lanka.
A wild vampire, aloof from the politics of his clan, the 'White God' is a dark deity of the Slavic pantheon.
One of the most thoroughly evil vampire to walk the earth, Hedeon is a chaotic aberration caring only his whims.
Second of command of Yorak and prophet of the Clan, Triglav was slain by the Dracon, starting a feud between their lineages.
The Voivode of Voivode's grasp on his clan is tenuous at best, bit its mere existence is a testament to Vladimir political skill and sheer resilience.
Caretaker of the resting place of Tzimisce himself, the Ruthven lineage carry prestige among the clan, despite its troubling genealogy.
The Butcher of Rus dwells in Kiev and doesn't allow anyone else to enter his city.
The son of Constantinople is a learned hedonist, broker of peace between his clan and the German Ventrue.
The rebel Childe of Tzimisce is an enigma. A survivor wishing for death, a lover spurning love and a father cursing his own progeny.
The leader of the Cathedral of Flesh and custodian of Tzimisce during his centuries of recovery, Yorak was the most important member of his clan for millenias.
An influential aristocrat among the Tzimisce, Tabak takes pride in choosing his childer with great care.
Cruel, even by Tzimisce standards, and ambitious to a fault, the Djavakhi lineage is one of brutal ambition.
Sometimes credited of bringing Vicissitude to the clan, this Greek childe of Tzimisce is one of the True Black Hand most well kept secret.
Ths African Tzimisce impressed the Eldest with his acceptance to change and is leading a blooming civilization despite his aberrant malformations.
The Little Grandmother is an horrifying creature running away from even more horrifying creatures.
The Jewish Prince of Prague is one of rebellion and rulership by trial. The ventrue didn't take kindly of the slaying of their old prince at his hands though.
The Matriarch is, with Baba Yaga, probably the only Childe of Absimilliard not bound blood to him. As such, she is a figure of mystery and reverence.
Locked in a bitter feud with his rivals, this nosferatu is one of the first to establish the characteristic web of information of his clan.
A key pillar of the Ashirra sect, the muslim nosferatus are stalwart guardians of the holy sites of Islam.
The shadow master of Denmark has recently lost control of his country after a long self imposed exile. His foes should take care not to think him dead though.
Perhaps only a myth, this Childe of Absimilliard was allegedly spared by the clan curse and has kept a normal appearance.
An ex prelate of the Eastern Roman Empire, Alexius was a skilled strategist and fighter.
The Usurper clan is besieged by powerful foes, but can count on the close bounds of blood and loyalty of its members.
The prodigal apprentice of Tremere is as powerful as he is ambitious. A dangerous duo for both friends and foes.
The main Setite lineage is the blood of a God, the founders of nations and the leaders of the only true religion.
Ambitious and ruthless, Sarrasine was always his own man, never to be tied to only allegeance besides himself.
This strange breed of Norse Setite is divided between the true believers of the great serpent and the greedy opportunists.
Ths mistress of the Dream Court is a scheming sorceress working for her mysterious sire, the Sleeping Lord.
The infamous Kemintiri, consort of Set, is one of the most well known and feared opponent of the Setite clan. Her schemes are the scale of legends.
The fierce rival of Kemintiri famously defeated her during an epic battle, earning the fame of a Goddess of War for herself.
This consort of Set is prone to succumb to random and inefficient scheming, often finding herself outwitted by the most unlikely of opponent.
A loyal agent of the Tal'Mahe'Ra, Nabonidus isn't above using personal feelings and manipulation to achieve his goals.
This ancient Assamite has kept the clan together since the disappearance of Haqim. Some says his presence is the only barrier between stability and a brutal schism.
The Queen of War and Love is the mysterious progenitor of some of the more famous, and infamous, Assamite to have ever walked the Earth.
This Childe of Haqim is the most fervent proponent of Islam among the clan. In the coming schism, he is the favorite.
The Herald of Destruction is probably the most fearsome vampire to still been active to this night. No one knows if he still only a vampire anymore.
The loyal right hand of Ur-Shulgi and leader of the Web of Knives is a powerful vampire, but has serious issues keeping his progeny in line.
The heretic follower of Lilith is a man stuck between the main clan and the fearsome True Black Hand. Still, he endures and even prosperes.
Izhim is the Thrice Cursed, the first victim of the Baali Curse and one of the founders of the True Black Hand.
One of the rare female embraced by Haqim, Nakurtum is ambitious and wishes for grand sweeping changes to the old order of the clan.
A seeker of Golconda, Abu Ilaf is aloof of Alamut politics and seek worthy students and teachers.
Native to Egypt, this lineage is renowned for his formal adherence to etiquette and severe self control.
The prestigious main lineage of the clan is the guardian of the Ravnos true legacy and identity.
The prodigal Childe story is a long one, full of sorrow, betrayals, hubris and ultimately, redemption.
The Great Enemy has cast his lot with demons, sorcerers and even more vile things, forever cursing clan Ravnos by his mere existence.
The stereotypical thief and liar has become the more numerous branch of the Ravnos clan in mainland Europe.
The 'criminals' are even less welcome in the muslim world than they are in the christian one, but their skills often find use.
The  'wonder maker' had made himself needed in Constantinople but didn't survive long after the city's fall.
The Italian necromancers are a very close knit family and hide many unsavories secrets.
The rebel Childe is a man of strange alliances, untold knowledge and few friends.
The loyal Childe is a peace loving and reclusive man, but if slighted, he will go to great lenghts to obtain revenge.
The reclusive Childe is the founder of one of the greatest city of the world, and operates behind the shadows to keep it his.
Utterly loyal to Ambrogino Giovanni, this small subgroup of the Giovanni family is single minded in its research of knowledge and power.
The cappadocian clan female bodyguards are fearsome warriors, and devoted worshippers of Lilith.
The heirs of Carthage's true legacy are utter monsters or unlikely guardians of humanity, depending on who you ask.
The devil worshippers want to see the world burn after a long, screaming agony.
The first warrior of the Salubri felled deamons by the dozens and, allegedly, defeated Tzimisce himself in single combat before dying from his wounds.
The wise counsel of this lineage of salubris has avoided many critical mistakes of being made.
The first healer of the Salubri is a songstress capable of healing body, mind and soul.
As the cainite world burns around them, the Twilight Order still accomplishes its duty of hunting and killing monsters.
The lineage of the Stoneman shunes the very ties of the blood that makes the cainite society what it is.
The greatest dynasty of the Silver Fang is the blood of rulers, heroes and martyrs.
Expert blacksmiths, the occidental Ashina are suddenly cut from their oriental brethren by the Anda invasion.
Leukippes was the forebear of the legend of the Amazons, fearsome female warriors of Scythia.
The Uniter of the Welsh Fianna is perhaps the last hope for his tribe to repel the undead followers of Mithras from Britannia.
Mockmaw's pack was seduced by the dark aura of Petaniqua and follows her around like very dangerous puppies.
Seeking to free the Wyrm from its chains, Drededoom will carve a bloody path in the islands if need be.
The Anda themselves believed they were scions of It�gen, the earth goddess of Mongolian religion. Dobrul was her favored son, cursed by the Wan Kuei.
The French peasant girl was a struglling Tremere apprentice before suddenly becoming the face of atleast a third of the whole clan.
Leader of Crowsong, a secret cult inside the True Black Hand, another secret cult, Phaedyme walks a very thin, and dangerous, line.
Elegant and sophisticated, the Milanese Lasombra is seeking challenges worthy of his attention.
Vlad Tepes is quite the legend among kine and cainites alike, and he is the only one allowed to add to it.
The Eternal Rebel is a rallying figure for revolutionnaries around the world. His charismatic, but somewhat reluctant, leadership is well known.
Child of the French Revolution, Laurette hasn't given up on her convictions with her death, far from it.
Noblesse oblige, Jan will save the only true vampiric institution, the Camarilla, from itself if need be.
A prestigious line of vampires, descending from one of the esteemed Founder of the Camarilla. Oh and, kill on sight for any Sabbat cainites, of course.
The cainites who have created the powerful Sabbat are legends of their sect� and obvious targets for Camarilla fanatics.
Descending from one of the first vampires to have broken the shackles of fealty, this lineage has en easy time rousing crowds of neonates.
The Beloved of the Moon is blessed by a prodigious beauty and loyalty to her lord and lover, Set.
The progressive Hierophant has made alliances with the wider Cainite world. His friendship with the Tremere leadership hasn't gone unnoticed however�
Rulers of the Laibon world, they are fierce warriors and protectors of Africa but also proud to a fault.
The Naglopers are expert in the fine art of torture, perfecting it to a point that could make an ancient Tzimisce blush.
The secretive sub branch of the Setite cult is too mysterious and strange for the taste of their Laibon brethren.
A nobleman, a diplomat and an astute administrator, Calderon sometimes has trouble keeping his hotheaded temper at bay.
A ruthless dealbreaker, De Cincao can make any alliance work. Even those not really condemned by his clan.
The Betrayer of Mistridge is an unsavory character, even by Tremere standards. His soul long lost, he will go to hell and beyond for his sire.
The diplomat and voice of reason of the Tremere council, Meerlinda is tasked with bringing England into the Tremere's dominion. Mithras isn't standing idle by though.
Loved as much as they are hated, the Etrius lineage expects respect and allegiance from all Tremere since they are, after all, the firsts among equals.
An occultist and learned mage, LeDuc was tasked by Tremere himself to unearth the secrets of the curse of Caine.
